CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Mietrechtsgesetz ) reads as follows :
“ Right to a tenancy in the event of death
( CARDINAL ) The death of the landlord or a tenant shall not terminate a tenancy .

( CARDINAL ) On the death of the main tenant of a flat , the persons designated in subsection ( CARDINAL ) as being entitled to succeed to the tenancy shall do so , to the exclusion of other persons entitled to succeed to the estate , unless they have notified the landlord within DATE of the main tenant 's death that they do not wish to continue the tenancy . If CARDINAL person is entitled to succeed , they shall succeed jointly to the tenancy and become jointly and severally liable .

( CARDINAL ) The following shall be entitled to succeed to the tenancy for the purposes of subsection ( CARDINAL ) : a spouse , a life companion , relatives in the direct line including adopted children , and siblings of the former tenant , in so far as such persons have a pressing need for accommodation and have already lived in the accommodation with the tenant as members of the same household . For the purposes of this provision , ' life companion ' shall mean a person who has lived in the flat with the former tenant until the latter 's death for DATE , sharing a household on an economic footing like that of a marriage ; a life companion shall be deemed to have lived in the flat for DATE if he or she moved into the flat together with the former tenant at the outset . ”
